channel.title: How do i do this properly?

item.title: How do i do this properly?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:4, topic:164524”][quote author=Stanyer link=topic=223361.msg1928695#msg1928695 date=1197589747]

If k = 0.

WCTimer must be bigger than 0. If you’ve put like. public int WCTimer = 0; Theyre both equal… So you have to make WCTimer bigger than k… k < WCTimer.

Doesn’t make sence tbh.
[/quote]

Yes it does… re-read your loop…

k < WCTimer…

That means if k is smaller than WCTimer. k++. Increases k…

If you haven’t increased WCTimer, it won’t do anything…

So you got like… public int WCTimer; …

Then you have to set the var. Like.

WCTimer = 10;

k < WCTimer. Now WCTimer = 10… So it will increase k 10 times.[/quote]

If WCTimer is 50, and k starts as 0… It’s gonna keep adding 1 till k reaches 50, so the if(k == WCTimer){ is right…

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this properly?

@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Stanyer, post:3, topic:164524”][quote author=X-J-K-X link=topic=223361.msg1928693#msg1928693 date=1197589676]
If k = 0.

WCTimer must be bigger than 0. If you’ve put like. public int WCTimer = 0; Theyre both equal… So you have to make WCTimer bigger than k… k < WCTimer.
[/quote]

Doesn’t make sence tbh.[/quote]

Yes it does… re-read your loop…

k < WCTimer…

That means if k is smaller than WCTimer. k++. Increases k…

If you haven’t increased WCTimer, it won’t do anything…

So you got like… public int WCTimer; …

Then you have to set the var. Like.

WCTimer = 10;

k < WCTimer. Now WCTimer = 10… So it will increase k 10 times.

item.title: How do i do this properly?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

for (int k = 0; k < WCTimer; k++) {
if(k == WCTimer){
addItem(LogID, AmountToChop);
sendMessage("You chop some "+LogName+"'s");
addSkillXP(ExpPerLog, 8);
actionTimer = WCTimer;
k = 0;
}
}

It just doesn’t do anything o,O

Its meant to keep adding +1 until it reaches the number of WCTimer, then when it does, it does the stuff inside of the loop, and then makes k 0 again

Read full topic
item.source: How do i do this properly?
